https://prez.dev/description.@value: The status of this register entry
The subject is an instance of a class.
The property that identifies the version IRI of an ontology.
A set of concepts, optionally including statements about semantic relationships between those concepts
A statement or formal explanation of the meaning of a concept
Relates, by convention, a concept scheme to a concept which is topmost in the broader/narrower concept hierarchies for that scheme, providing an entry point to these hierarchies
A note about the past state/use/meaning of a concept
The preferred lexical label for a resource, in a given language
If this Entity prov:wasAttributedTo Agent :ag, then it can qualify how it was influenced using prov:qualifiedAttribution [ a prov:Attribution;  prov:agent :ag; :foo :bar ].

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: The Australasian Code for Reporting of Exploration Results, Mineral Resources and Ore Reserves ('the JORC Code') is a professional code of practice that sets mandatory, minimum standards for Public Reporting of minerals Exploration Results, Mineral Resources and Ore Reserves, according to the levels of confidence in geological knowledge and technical and economic considerations. The JORC Code is prepared by the Joint Ore Reserves Committee of the Australasian Institute of Mining and Metallurgy, the Australian Institute of Geoscientists and the Minerals Council of Australia as in force from time to time (JORC; https://jorc.org/) and was last updated in 2012 (https://jorc.org/docs/JORC_code_2012.pdf). The JORC Committee was established in 1971, and is sponsored by the Australian mining industry and its professional organisations. The JORC Committee is a member of CRIRSCO, the Committee for Mineral Reserves International Reporting Standards (CRIRSCO; https://www.crirsco.com/).

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value:
The Mines and Mineral Deposits (MINEDEX) system maintained by the Geological Survey of Western Australia requires exploration and mining companies operating in the State to submit Resource information based on the JORC or equivalent Codes. As of May 2023, the Mining Act 1978 requires submissions to be compliant with the 2004 JORC Code; the 2012 version of the JORC Code (https://jorc.org/docs/JORC_code_2012.pdf) is covered in this vocabulary and there are no term differences between the two.

The JORC Code vocabulary covers [MINEDEX].[ResourceEstimate.ResourceCategory], i.e. resource or reserve, and [MINEDEX].[ResourceEstimate.ResourceStatus], i.e. the status of resource/reserve (e.g. inferred, measured).

https://schema.org/version.@value: 1.1: updated IRI to use lowercase characters

https://prez.dev/description.@value: The Australasian Code for Reporting of Exploration Results, Mineral Resources and Ore Reserves ('the JORC Code') is a professional code of practice that sets mandatory, minimum standards for Public Reporting of minerals Exploration Results, Mineral Resources and Ore Reserves, according to the levels of confidence in geological knowledge and technical and economic considerations. The JORC Code is prepared by the Joint Ore Reserves Committee of the Australasian Institute of Mining and Metallurgy, the Australian Institute of Geoscientists and the Minerals Council of Australia as in force from time to time (JORC; https://jorc.org/) and was last updated in 2012 (https://jorc.org/docs/JORC_code_2012.pdf). The JORC Committee was established in 1971, and is sponsored by the Australian mining industry and its professional organisations. The JORC Committee is a member of CRIRSCO, the Committee for Mineral Reserves International Reporting Standards (CRIRSCO; https://www.crirsco.com/).
An entry that has been accepted for use and is visible in the default register listing. Includes entries that have seen been retired or superseded.
A profile for SKOS Concept Schemes
The creator/author of this CreativeWork. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork
The date on which the CreativeWork was created or the item was added to a DataFeed
The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed
Keywords or tags used to describe some item. Multiple textual entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas, or by repeating the property
The publisher of the creative work
The version of the CreativeWork embodied by a specified resource
